==Events==
*[[1099]] &ndash; [[First Crusade]]: [[Christian]] soldiers take the [[Church of the Holy Sepulchre]] in [[Jerusalem]] after the final assault of [[Siege of Jerusalem (1099)|a difficult siege]].
*[[1149]] &ndash; The reconstructed [[Church of the Holy Sepulchre]] is consecrated in Jerusalem.
*[[1207]] &ndash; King [[John, King of England|John of England]] expels [[Canterbury]] monks for supporting [[Archbishop of Canterbury|Archbishop]] [[Stephen Langton]].
*[[1240]] &ndash; [[Swedish–Novgorodian Wars]]: a [[Veliky Novgorod|Novgorod]]ian army led by [[Alexander Nevsky]] defeats the [[Sweden|Swedes]] in the [[Battle of the Neva]].
*[[1381]] &ndash; [[John Ball (priest)|John Ball]], a leader in the [[Peasants' Revolt]], is [[hanged, drawn and quartered]] in the presence of King [[Richard II of England]].
*[[1410]] &ndash; [[Polish–Lithuanian–Teutonic War]]: [[Battle of Grunwald]] &ndash; the allied forces of the [[History of Poland during the Jagiellon dynasty|Kingdom of Poland]] and the [[Grand Duchy of Lithuania]] defeat the army of the [[Teutonic Knights|Teutonic Order]].
*[[1482]] &ndash; [[Muhammad XII of Granada|Muhammad XII]] is crowned the twenty-second and last [[Nasrid dynasty|Nasrid]] king of [[Emirate of Granada|Granada]].
*[[1685]] &ndash; [[Monmouth Rebellion]]: [[James Scott, 1st Duke of Monmouth]] is executed at [[Tower Hill]], [[England]] after his defeat at the [[Battle of Sedgemoor]] on 6 July 1685.
*[[1741]] &ndash; [[Aleksei Chirikov]] sights land in Southeast [[Alaska]]. He sends men ashore in a longboat, making them the first Europeans to visit Alaska.
*[[1789]] &ndash; [[Gilbert du Motier, marquis de Lafayette]], is named by acclamation [[Colonel General]] of the new [[National Guard (France)|National Guard]] of [[Paris]].
*[[1799]] &ndash; The [[Rosetta Stone]] is found in the [[Egypt]]ian village of [[Rosetta]] by [[France|French]] [[Captain (OF-2)|Captain]] [[Pierre-François Bouchard]] during [[Napoleon]]'s [[French campaign in Egypt and Syria|Egyptian Campaign]].
*[[1806]] &ndash; [[Pike expedition]]: [[United States Army]] [[Lieutenant]] [[Zebulon Pike]] begins an expedition from [[Fort Bellefontaine]] near [[St. Louis, Missouri]],  to explore the west.
*[[1815]] &ndash; [[Napoleonic Wars]]: [[Napoleon Bonaparte]] surrenders aboard {{HMS|Bellerophon|1786|6}}.
*[[1823]] &ndash; A fire destroys the ancient [[Basilica of Saint Paul Outside the Walls]] in [[Rome|Rome, Italy]].
*[[1834]] &ndash; The [[Spanish Inquisition]] is officially disbanded after nearly 356 years of terror.
*[[1838]] &ndash; [[Ralph Waldo Emerson]] delivers the [[Divinity School Address]] at [[Harvard Divinity School]], discounting Biblical miracles and declaring Jesus a great man, but not God.  The Protestant community reacts with outrage.
*[[1870]] &ndash; [[Reconstruction Era of the United States]]: [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]] becomes the last of the former [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] states to be readmitted to the [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]].
*  1870   &ndash; [[Rupert's Land]] and the [[North-Western Territory]] are transferred to [[Canada]] from the [[Hudson's Bay Company]], and the province of [[Manitoba]] and the [[Northwest Territories]] are established from these vast territories.
*[[1888]] &ndash; The [[stratovolcano]] [[Mount Bandai]] [[1888 eruption of Mount Bandai|erupts]] killing approximately 500 people, in [[Fukushima Prefecture]], [[Japan]].
*[[1910]] &ndash; In his book ''Clinical Psychiatry'', [[Emil Kraepelin]] gives a name to [[Alzheimer's disease]], naming it after his colleague [[Alois Alzheimer]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; In [[Seattle|Seattle, Washington]], [[William Boeing]] and [[George Conrad Westervelt]] incorporate Pacific Aero Products (later renamed [[Boeing]]).
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: the [[Second Battle of the Marne]] begins near the [[Marne (river)|River Marne]] with a [[Germany|German]] attack.
*[[1920]] &ndash; The [[Second Polish Republic|Polish]] Parliament establishes [[Silesian Voivodeship (1920–1939)|Silesian Voivodeship]] before the [[Upper Silesia plebiscite|Polish-German plebiscite]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; [[Japanese Communist Party]] is established in Japan. 
*[[1927]] &ndash; [[July Revolt of 1927|Massacre of July 15, 1927]]: 89 protesters are killed by the [[Austria]]n police in [[Vienna]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; First flight of the [[Boeing 367-80]], prototype for both the [[Boeing 707]] and [[Boeing C-135 Stratolifter|C-135]] series.
*[[1955]] &ndash; Eighteen [[Nobel Prize|Nobel laureate]]s sign the [[Mainau Declaration]] against [[nuclear weapon]]s, later co-signed by thirty-four others.
*[[1959]] &ndash; The [[steel strike of 1959]] begins, leading to significant importation of foreign [[steel]] for the first time in [[United States]] history.
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: The United States and South Vietnam begin [[Operation Hastings]] to push the North Vietnamese out of the [[Vietnamese Demilitarized Zone]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; In [[Nicosia]], [[Cyprus]], [[Greek military junta of 1967–1974|Greek Junta]]-sponsored nationalists launch a [[coup d'état]], deposing [[President]] [[Makarios III|Makarios]] and installing [[Nikos Sampson]] as [[Cyprus|Cypriot]] [[president]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[Space Race]]: [[Apollo–Soyuz Test Project]] features the dual launch of an [[Apollo program|Apollo spacecraft]] and a [[Soyuz (spacecraft)|Soyuz spacecraft]] on the first joint Soviet-United States human-crewed flight. It was both the last launch of an Apollo spacecraft, and the [[Saturn (rocket family)|Saturn family of rockets]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[United States|U.S.]] [[President of the United States|President]] [[Jimmy Carter]] gives his so-called [[malaise speech]], where he characterizes the greatest threat to the country as "this crisis in the growing doubt about the meaning of our own lives and in the loss of a unity of purpose for our nation" but in which he never uses the word ''malaise''.
*[[1980]] &ndash; A [[Western Wisconsin Derecho|massive storm]] tears through western [[Wisconsin]], causing US$160 million in damage.
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Orly Airport attack]] is launched by [[Armenia]]n militant organisation [[Armenian Secret Army for the Liberation of Armenia|ASALA]] at the [[Paris-Orly Airport]] in [[Paris]]; it leaves 8 people dead and 55 injured.
*[[1996]] &ndash; A [[Belgian Air Component|Belgian Air Force]] [[Lockheed C-130 Hercules|C-130 Hercules]] carrying the [[Royal Netherlands Army]] marching band crashes on landing at [[Eindhoven Airport]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; In [[Miami|Miami, Florida]], [[serial killer]] [[Andrew Cunanan]] guns down [[Gianni Versace]] outside his home.
*[[2002]] &ndash; "American [[Taliban]]" [[John Walker Lindh]] pleads guilty to supplying aid to the enemy and to possession of explosives during the commission of a [[felony]].
*  2002   &ndash; Anti-Terrorism Court of [[Pakistan]] hands down the death sentence to [[United Kingdom|British]] born [[Ahmed Omar Saeed Sheikh]] and life terms to three others suspected of murdering ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'' reporter [[Daniel Pearl]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Time Warner|AOL Time Warner]] disbands [[Netscape]]. The [[Mozilla Foundation]] is established on the same day
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[Twitter]] is launched, becoming one of the largest [[social media]] platforms in the world.
